revised_title: Extraordinary Agitation of Waters in Mount's-Bay and Other Places on 31st March 1761
tldr: The author, William Borlase, describes an unusual tidal event that occurred on March 31, 1761, in Mount's-Bay, Cornwall, and other locations. The tide exhibited a sudden and significant motion, rising and falling multiple times within an hour. This phenomenon was also observed in other places, such as Scotland, Ireland, and Portugal, and was accompanied by reports of earthquakes and other seismic activity.
